content:
These regex patterns are tools for parsing and processing specific text formats within documentation strings. They are used to identify certain method references or annotations, such as "@c", "@p", and various method/class syntaxes, likely in the context of autodoc processing.

Succinct Context:
The regex patterns `at_c_at_p_pattern` and `method_class_ref_pattern` are defined for use in parsing and processing documentation strings, aiding in the identification of specific annotations or references within text during autodoc operations.

# Regex patterns.
at_c_at_p_pattern = re.compile(r'@[cp]\s+([^\s]+)')
method_class_ref_pattern = re.compile(r'([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_.:]*)\(\)|([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*::[a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_.:]*)(\(\))?|([a-zA-Z_]+[A-Z0-9_][a-zA-Z0-9_.:]*)(\(\))?')
